item.title: The Dream Room
item.description: Liljevalchs in Stockholm has invited 13 of Swedens most prominent experts on antiquities and provided them with a gallery each. In contrast to their normal line of work with other peoples objects, they have been assigned to capture and share their passion for collecting. The result is 13 personal dream rooms, which provide the audience with insights into the powerful drives behind collecting and especially the strong love for objects and their histories.
item.content:encoded: Liljevalchs in Stockholm has invited 13 of Swedens most prominent experts on antiquities and provided them with a gallery each. In contrast to their normal line of work with other peoples objects, they have been assigned to capture and share their passion for collecting. The result is 13 personal dream rooms, which provide the audience with insights into the powerful drives behind collecting and especially the strong love for objects and their histories.

item.title: MSCED
item.description: Throughout 2011 I will do something creative each day. In most cases this will be some piece of graphic design on a subject that stirs my interests, or simply based on a photograph I've made or found. Follow the progress on msced.mariusroosendaal.com.
item.content:encoded: Throughout 2011 I will do something creative each day. In most cases this will be some piece of graphic design on a subject that stirs my interests, or simply based on a photograph I've made or found. Follow the progress on msced.mariusroosendaal.com.

item.title: Bayer Vision Project
item.description: This is a project for the Master of Design (MDes) at Hong Kong Polytechnic University under the direction of Prof. Peter Dean in collaboration with Bayer Plastics. The project explores an innovative plastic coating material, Lyttron. It is a EL (electroluminescent) film coating that can be applied on many plastics. The various objects attempts to utilize this property to create innovative lighting and display furniture pieces for the home as well as retail environments.
item.content:encoded: This is a project for the Master of Design (MDes) at Hong Kong Polytechnic University under the direction of Prof. Peter Dean in collaboration with Bayer Plastics. The project explores an innovative plastic coating material, Lyttron. It is a EL (electroluminescent) film coating that can be applied on many plastics. The various objects attempts to utilize this property to create innovative lighting and display furniture pieces for the home as well as retail environments.

item.title: Eternal Moments / Animated Photos
item.description: "What the Photograph reproduces to infinity has occurred only once: the Photograph mechanically repeats what could never be repeated existentially." Roland Barthes (Camera Lucida: Reflections on Photography)

item.title: YWFT Pello
item.description: YWFT Pello has three weights (light, regular and bold), includes Opentype features like contextual alternates, fractions, and ligatures, and contains 265 glyph designs.

item.title: NAF
item.description: NAF (Norwegian Automobile Association) is a memebership organisation focussed on managing the needs of Norwegian motorists. With new goals for increasing memebrship they appointed Mission to undertake a repositioning programme. Our research revealed various challenges. NAF members expected more for their membership, the brand needed to align itself towards families instead of primarily male drivers and they needed to improve their overall communication by being clearer and more engaging. We concluded that NAFs position had evolved beyond breakdown assistance and should reflect the bigger concept of Mobility. To convey this we revised NAFs brand heirarchy focussing on services. We also improved the visual identity and tone-of-voice to provide a more tangible impression of NAF's service. All aspects of NAFs communication have been redesigned. Mission is currently implementing a new retail concept based on Mobility to provide customers with more insight and contact with the NAF brand. Missions strength is to see the bigger picture of the brand whilst focussing on the day to day steps to get there. The process has been challenging for all, but nevertheless exciting and inspiring thanks to Mission, comments Tone Rydjord, Marketing Manager for NAF.
item.content:encoded: NAF (Norwegian Automobile Association) is a memebership organisation focussed on managing the needs of Norwegian motorists. With new goals for increasing memebrship they appointed Mission to undertake a repositioning programme. Our research revealed various challenges. NAF members expected more for their membership, the brand needed to align itself towards families instead of primarily male drivers and they needed to improve their overall communication by being clearer and more engaging. We concluded that NAFs position had evolved beyond breakdown assistance and should reflect the bigger concept of Mobility. To convey this we revised NAFs brand heirarchy focussing on services. We also improved the visual identity and tone-of-voice to provide a more tangible impression of NAF's service. All aspects of NAFs communication have been redesigned. Mission is currently implementing a new retail concept based on Mobility to provide customers with more insight and contact with the NAF brand. Missions strength is to see the bigger picture of the brand whilst focussing on the day to day steps to get there. The process has been challenging for all, but nevertheless exciting and inspiring thanks to Mission, comments Tone Rydjord, Marketing Manager for NAF.

item.title: Altitude
item.description: The camera is suspended from a kite, I guide it, feeling out the best image possibilities. I cannot see what I'm capturing so it becomes an intuitive creative process. The more I relax, the better the images.
item.content:encoded: The camera is suspended from a kite, I guide it, feeling out the best image possibilities. I cannot see what I'm capturing so it becomes an intuitive creative process. The more I relax, the better the images.

item.title: RANDOM 011
item.description: Here is a selection of paintings I recently did, from FACES II, CORPUS and FACE. The moment where little is enough to suggest the structure interests me. Knowing when to stop before saying too much is still an active ingredient in my research.
item.content:encoded: Here is a selection of paintings I recently did, from FACES II, CORPUS and FACE. The moment where little is enough to suggest the structure interests me. Knowing when to stop before saying too much is still an active ingredient in my research.

item.title: The Alba Series (2008-2010)
item.description: In December 2008 I moved from the United States to Edinburgh, Scotland. This was the first time I had ever left the USA. The work I produced during this two-year stay is a reflection of my experiences and psychological reactions to this new environment.
item.content:encoded: In December 2008 I moved from the United States to Edinburgh, Scotland. This was the first time I had ever left the USA. The work I produced during this two-year stay is a reflection of my experiences and psychological reactions to this new environment.

item.title: COOKIE SCOTLAND
item.description: I was commissioned to design the branding, designs and artwork for a new restaurant in Glasgow opening 'Cookie' where the menu changes seasonally and a generation brought up on fish fingers and chicken nougats such as myself get an education on some proper authentic food that will leave your tongue dripping with digestive pleasure! Restaurant is based in the Southside of Glasgow off from Queens park train station. www.cookiescotland.com cookie scotland ltd. 72 nithsdale road glasgow G41 2AN
item.content:encoded: I was commissioned to design the branding, designs and artwork for a new restaurant in Glasgow opening 'Cookie' where the menu changes seasonally and a generation brought up on fish fingers and chicken nougats such as myself get an education on some proper authentic food that will leave your tongue dripping with digestive pleasure! Restaurant is based in the Southside of Glasgow off from Queens park train station. www.cookiescotland.com cookie scotland ltd. 72 nithsdale road glasgow G41 2AN
